data.content:
noun
US or Brit pot luck , pl -lucks
[count] US :a meal to which everyone who is invited brings food to share
He organized a neighborhood potluck for next Saturday. - often used before another noun
a potluck dinner/supper
[noncount] chiefly Brit :a meal for a guest that is prepared from whatever is available
I wasn't expecting you for dinner, so you'll have to take pot luck. - often used figuratively
We don't have definite plans. We're just going to take pot luck. [=we're just going to take/accept whatever is available and hope that it is good]
